main event: A civilian observed a star-like white light stationary on the rim of the dark portion of the sky for about 5 minutes.
interesting points: The light was the size of a bright star and appeared stationary during observation., The observation took place five miles north of Roswell, New Mexico., The witness noted that the light faded out after five minutes., The observer was a 35-year-old section foreman with a reliability above average., The report evaluated the sighting as insufficient data due to lack of corroborating information.
witness description: civilian, age 35, section foreman with Trans-Western Pipeline
